title: Verghese Kurien
summary: Verghese Kurien (26 November 1921 -  9 September 2012), known as the "Father of the White Revolution" in India,[2][3] was a social entrepreneur whose "billion-litre idea", Operation Flood,[4][5] made dairy farming India's largest self-sustaining industry and the largest rural employment sector providing a third of all rural income.[6] It made India the world's largest milk producer, doubled the milk available for each person, and increased milk output four-fold in 30 years.[7]
